result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shawn Timothy Michaels

records.addlTxt:
4:05 PM Defendant Shawn Timothy Michaels in court. Attorney Jeffrey A Jaeger appeared by phone for Shawn Timothy Michaels. Prosecuting attorney Claudia T. Johnson in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing questionnaire & waiver filed. Probable Cause Found, Defendant bound over.
Information filed/reading waived, Not guilty plea entered all Counts. 
As to bond motion - Atty Jaeger states Deft had a relapse and does not intend to again, states Deft can post additional $300.00 cash.
Court will give Deft one more opportunity without increasing bond, but urges Deft to get into treatment.
Scheduling conference scheduled for February 7, 2023 at 10:00 am.
Scheduling conference on February 7, 2023 at 10:00 am.

Atty Jaeger - proceed w/Prelim on Wednesday. Court will adjourn Bond Hearing to Wednesday and require in person appearance even though there is a waiver on file.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
